title: How to Make a Nakamura Lock Paper Airplane

steps.title: Fold a piece of paper in half and crease it.
steps.content: Fold a piece of paper in half and crease it. Open it back up (hot dog style). Press creases with your thumbnail to ensure clean folds, and make sure youâ€™re folding on a flat surface like a table or desk for better accuracy.

steps.title: Fold the top 2 corners down so that there's a triangle above.
steps.content: Fold the top 2 corners down so that there's a triangle above.

steps.title: Fold the triangle to the bottom.
steps.content: Fold the triangle to the bottom.

steps.title: Fold the top corners down to a point in the middle of the triangle and fold the bottom of the triangle over the corners that were folded down.
steps.content: Fold the top corners down to a point in the middle of the triangle and fold the bottom of the triangle over the corners that were folded down.

steps.title: Fold it in half.
steps.content: Fold it in half. If you fold it in half the right way, you should see a triangle in the middle on both sides.

steps.title: Fold the top edge to the bottom edge on one side.
steps.content: Fold the top edge to the bottom edge on one side. Do the same on the other side. It'll be one of the best airplanes you've ever made.

steps.title: To fly it, give it a super light push.
steps.content: To fly it, give it a super light push. If you push too hard, it won't fly but you and the plane will stay AWESOME!
